qas.question: What year marked the beginning of the High Middle Ages?
What event led to larger crop yields in the High Middle Ages?
What was the name of the economic system that organized peasants into villages owing labor and rent to nobles?
What was the name of the political system that gave rents to knights in return for military service?
In what year did the Crusades begin?

context: During the High Middle Ages, which began after <a0_0>1000<a0_0/>, the population of Europe increased greatly as technological and agricultural innovations allowed trade to flourish and <a1_0>the Medieval Warm Period<a1_0/> climate change allowed crop yields to increase. <a2_0>Manorialism<a2_0/>, the organisation of peasants into villages that owed rent and labour services to the nobles, and <a3_0>feudalism<a3_0/>, the political structure whereby knights and lower-status nobles owed military service to their overlords in return for the right to rent from lands and manors, were two of the ways society was organised in the High Middle Ages. The Crusades, first preached in <a4_0>1095<a4_0/>, were military attempts by Western European Christians to regain control of the Holy Land from the Muslims. Kings became the heads of centralised nation states, reducing crime and violence but making the ideal of a unified Christendom more distant. Intellectual life was marked by scholasticism, a philosophy that emphasised joining faith to reason, and by the founding of universities. The theology of Thomas Aquinas, the paintings of Giotto, the poetry of Dante and Chaucer, the travels of Marco Polo, and the architecture of Gothic cathedrals such as Chartres are among the outstanding achievements toward the end of this period, and into the Late Middle Ages.
